wiki.content: "Wherever You Will Go" is a song by The Calling released as the first single off their debut album Camino Palmero. The Wherever You Will Go Songfacts explains that it was written by guitarist Aaron Kamin after attending the funeral of his grandmother's best friend. She left behind a husband of 50 or more years and afterwards he started thinking of what it would be like to be him and have your whole life change so dramatically. It still remains their most renowned and their most successful hit, peaking at #5 on the Billboard Hot 100 and topping the Adult Top 40 for 23 weeks, setting a record for that chart behind Santana's hit song Smooth. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Wherever You Will Go" is a song by The Calling released as the first single off their debut album Camino Palmero. The Wherever You Will Go Songfacts explains that it was written by guitarist Aaron Kamin after attending the funeral of his grandmother's best friend. She left behind a husband of 50 or more years and afterwards he started thinking of what it would be like to be him and have your whole life change so dramatically.

track.name: Wherever You Will Go
comments: ahhh~ good memories from all the times this song came on...

This song is a CLASSIC. [7] 
Great song, never gets old. [3]
sounds similar to some other songs from the time, but its unique.
Holy crap, I almost forgot about this song! It's always been so beautiful to me, and I used to listen to it a lot as a kid.
gets me in tears every time.
High School Flashback. I love this album.
Nice to see lots of shouts for a song that never gets old!  Such an underrated band, yet Alex has the BEST voice in the business!!
